org.apache.river.qa.harness

Interface ConfigurationVerifier

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActivatableMahaloVerifier, ActivatableMercuryVerifier, ActivatableOutriggerVerifier, FullLoggingVerifier, ListExclusionVerifier, SharedVMVerifier, SkipConfigTestVerifier, SkipDistributedVerifier, SkipLinuxTestVerifier, SkipMacTestVerifier, SkipNonSunJDKTestVerifier, SkipPostJDK14TestVerifier, SkipSolarisHttpTestVerifier, SkipTestVerifier, TransientModeVerifier, UnsharedVMVerifier

    public interface ConfigurationVerifier
    A verifier used to determine whether a test is capable of being run in a particular environment. Tests which require a particular execution environment, such as running in shared VM mode, may provide implementations of this interface. A test which fails to verify will not be considered to have failed.

    The configuration is searched for the key org.apache.river.qa.harness.verifier. If the key is found, its value is interpreted as the name of a class to instantiate via a no-arg constructor, implementing this interface. The value of the canRun method determines whether the test can be run. If the key does not exist, then it is assumed that the test can be run in all configurations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canRun(TestDescription td, QAConfig config)
      Return an indication of whether the test should be run.

    • Method Detail

      • canRun

        boolean canRun(TestDescription td,
               QAConfig config)
        Return an indication of whether the test should be run.
        Parameters:
        td - the test description for the test
        config - the configuration object
        Returns:
        true if the test can be run in this configuration
